Posted By: littlebeast (11/24/2009 3:46:22 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: From experience I can say that nearly all of the Hunted cards are quite dangerous to use, as any simple removal spell will give your opponent double the card advantage. I had two Ravnica block decks in which I tried to use these guys. I took the Lammasu out of my Boros deck after getting killed by the 4/4 horror, and the Hunted Troll out of my Golgari deck when my opponent kept chump blocking the troll and hitting me with the four 1/1 flyers. The [Hunted Dragon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hunted Dragon), however, shines among this cycle. Not only does it have haste, which allows you to cast it when your opponent is tapped out and attack at least once without risking removal, but it can't be blocked by the tokens it generates. Many people still feel relatively safe at 6 life - Hunted Dragon makes a great finisher. Even better if you have a way to pump it.
posts.html:

I like the Hunted cards, got hunted Phantasm and dragon in my [Leyline of Singularity](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Leyline of Singularity) - Deck, paired with [Dingus staff](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dingus staff) you can mess up your opponents Life pretty quick :)
